argumentText:
Let $X$ be a second countable topological space, $A\subseteq X$ any
subset and $\mathcal{U}$ an open cover of $A$. Let $\mathcal{B}$ be a
countable basis for $X$; then $\mathcal{B}' =
\{B\cap A\colon B\in\mathcal{B}\}$ is a countable basis of the subspace
topology on A. Then for each $a\in A$ there is some $U_a\in\mathcal{U}$
with $a\in U_a$, and so there is $B_a\in\mathcal{B}'$ such that
$a\in B_a\subseteq U_a$.

Then $\{B_a\in\mathcal{B}'\colon a\in A\}\subseteq\mathcal{B}$ is a
countable open cover of $A$. For each $B_a$, choose
$U_{B_a}\in\mathcal{U}$ such that $B_a\subseteq U_{B_a}$. Then
$\{ U_{B_a}\colon a\in A\}$ is a countable subcover of $A$ from
$\mathcal{U}$.$\square$
